unnormalised: A recent spike in dengue cases has public health officials in Guwahati on high alert. As of 16/10/2024, the Kamrup Metropolitan district has reported 350+ confirmed cases, a significant jump from the 120 cases recorded in the same period last year. The Assam State Health Department is urging residents to take preventive measures to control the spread of the mosquito-borne illness.
normalised: A recent spike in dengue cases has public health officials in Guwahati on high alert. As of sixteenth october two thousand and twenty four, the Kamrup Metropolitan district has reported three hundred and fifty plus confirmed cases, a significant jump from the one hundred and twenty cases recorded in the same period last year. The Assam State Health Department is urging residents to take preventive measures to control the spread of the mosquito-borne illness.

unnormalised: The increase is attributed to the prolonged monsoon season and subsequent waterlogging, creating ideal breeding grounds for mosquitoes. Dr. Himanta Biswa Sarma, the state's Health Minister, held an emergency meeting yesterday, 15/10/2024, to discuss strategies for curbing the outbreak. These include intensified fogging drives, distribution of mosquito nets, and public awareness campaigns across the city.

Doctor Himanta Biswa Sarma, the state's Health Minister, held an emergency meeting yesterday, fifteenth october two thousand and twenty four, to discuss strategies for curbing the outbreak. These include intensified fogging drives, distribution of mosquito nets, and public awareness campaigns across the city.

unnormalised: Health workers from the Guwahati Municipal Corporation (GMC) are visiting homes to educate people about eliminating stagnant water sources, like in flower pots and old tyres. Additionally, they are distributing leaflets with information on dengue symptoms and prevention tips. The department has also allocated an additional Rs. 50 lakh for procuring necessary medical supplies and equipment for the Guwahati Medical College and Hospital (GMCH).

The department has also allocated an additional rupee fifty lakh for procuring necessary medical supplies and equipment for the Guwahati Medical College and Hospital (G-M-C-H).

unnormalised: Citizens are advised to seek immediate medical attention if they experience symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, and joint pain. The Health Minister has assured that the state government is committed to controlling the situation and ensuring the well-being of the public. Regular updates will be provided, with the next press briefing scheduled for 20/10/2024 at 11 AM.
